“The upside risks to inflation have diminished. And the downside risks to employment have increased,” Powell said in a highly anticipated speech to the Kansas City Fed’s annual economic conference in Jackson Hole, Wyoming.
Economists expect the Bank of Japan to increase borrowing costs again by December.

site_title: 7-Eleven, beloved in Japan, is facing a foreign buyout
summary: Seven & i Holdings, the Japanese company that operates 7-Eleven, has received an unsolicited takeover proposal from Canadian convenience store giant Alimentation Couche-Tard. The proposal, which would make Couche-Tard the largest foreign-led acquisition of a Japanese company, faces significant obstacles due to differences in operating convenience stores and the holding company's diverse business interests. Analysts argue that Couche-Tard would need to demonstrate how it could improve 7-Eleven's core business, which generates a large portion of its operating profit. Japan is unlikely to part with 7-Eleven, considering it a cornerstone of Japanese society.

images.alt_text: Seven & i grew from small beginnings, tracing its origins to the small family-owned Yokado Clothing Store that first opened in Tokyo in 1920.
The company’s empire now spans 85,000 convenience stores, petrol stations and retail outlets worldwide.

site_title: Bank of England’s Bailey says risk of persistent inflation is receding in UK
summary: BOE governor Andrew Bailey expressed growing confidence in the UK's inflation outlook, stating that the risks of persistent inflation are receding. Bailey said the "second round inflation effects appear to be smaller than expected," and that the central bank is now seeing a revision down in its assessment of intrinsic persistence. The BOE is expected to keep interest rates steady for now, with no guidance on potential cuts in September, and may move again in November to 4.75% to keep inflation around the 2% target.

images.alt_text: At the September Fed gathering, officials will also issue a fresh set of economic projections and indicate where they anticipate their policy rate will be at the end of each year through 2026.

site_title: Bank of China appoints Ge acting president after Liu resigns
summary: Bank of China's president, Liu Jin, resigned after nearly three years in the role due to personal reasons, effective August 25. Chairman Ge Haijiao will serve as acting president. The bank reported a 2.9% year-on-year decline in first-quarter net income to 56 billion yuan. There were no disagreements with the board, and Liu confirmed no matters needed attention from shareholders. The move follows Liu's absence from a board meeting.

images.alt_text: Washington on Friday imposed sweeping sanctions against almost 400 individuals and companies it believes are aiding Russia’s war in Ukraine, including several Chinese firms, expanding existing measures to curb Moscow over the invasion of its neighbour.

site_title: New dawn for S-Reits as Fed rate cuts get underway
summary: The Federal Reserve is set to deliver its first rate cut in September, with minutes from the July meeting showing "the vast majority" of participants believe easing policy is appropriate. This move is expected to positively impact Singapore-listed real estate investment trusts (S-Reits), particularly those with a small proportion of loans tied to fixed rates. Despite concerns about underlying fundamentals, experts recommend investors focus on the retail, industrial, and office sectors, with top picks including FCT, Lendlease Reit, and Clar. However, fundraising and acquisitions are likely to increase as managers prepare for more acquisitions, and it may take several months for S-Reits to report higher distributable income.

images.alt_text: The Marriner S. Eccles Federal Reserve building in Washington, DC, US, on Wednesday, Aug. 21, 2024. Chair Jerome Powell will usher in the next chapter in the Federal Reserve's inflation battle on Friday, when he's expected to set the table for an interest-rate cut while reassuring investors that policymakers can stave off a sharp economic slowdown. Photographer: Ting Shen/Bloomberg

site_title: Billionaire Adani’s Mumbai slum revamp struggles to secure land in potential setback
summary: Billionaire Gautam Adani's plan to rehabilitate India's largest slum, Dharavi, is facing a setback due to struggles to secure land. Despite winning a $619 million bid, Adani Group's joint venture has yet to secure additional land to rehabilitate the 700,000 people considered ineligible for free homes. Government agencies are unwilling to part with land, citing their own plans, posing a critical challenge to the project timeline. The project aims to rehouse a million people and is a high-profile initiative for Adani, who faces allegations of business mismanagement.

images.alt_text: Adani’s empire has been growing at a breakneck pace in the past five years, often by piling on more debt.

site_title: Scramble for critical minerals spurs an African rail revival
summary: Southern Africa's rail network is experiencing a revival as governments and investors seek to capitalize on growing demand for critical materials, particularly copper, to support the global energy transition. A scramble for investment has led to billions of dollars in new funding, with rail lines in countries such as Angola, Tanzania, and Zambia being revitalized or built from scratch. The US, European Union, and China are all backing efforts to develop the region's rail infrastructure, with the US committing $553 million to a project in Angola and Zambia planning a $1 billion refurbishment with China.

images.alt_text: train, tracks, railway

site_title: Baltic Exchange Shipping Insights
summary: The Baltic Exchange Shipping Insights report for August 23, 2024, highlights a strong upward trend in the Capesize market, with the Baltic 5TC index rising to $23,645 by Friday. The Panamax market experienced a downward trend, with the Panamax timecharter average falling from $13,970 to $12,724. The Atlantic market saw improved activity, particularly in South Brazil, while the US Gulf market showed signs of recovery. In the tanker market, the VLCC market continued its downward trajectory, with the rate for the TD3C benchmark 270,000 mt Middle East Gulf to China falling to WS52.95. The LNG market saw bearish sentiment, with rates declining across all routes.

site_title: US says it killed senior militant group leader in Syria
summary: US forces carried out a drone strike in Syria, killing senior leader Abu Abdul Rahman al-Makki, a member of the Hurras al-Din Shura Council and Al-Qaeda-affiliated militant group. The strike targeted Makki, a Saudi national, in the southern Idlib countryside. The US Central Command confirmed the operation, stating that Hurras al-Din poses a threat to US and Western interests. This incident is part of American forces' periodic strikes in Syria targeting militants from the Islamic State group and other jihadist organizations.

site_title: What a restructuring means for your job, and how to prepare for it
summary: In an uncertain job market, employees can prepare for potential restructuring by gathering clues about their company's direction. This involves paying attention to internal communication, such as mentions of streamlining operations or exploring strategic partnerships. Understanding the implications of restructuring, including mergers, acquisitions, dissolution, and liquidation, can help employees make informed decisions about their careers and finances. By being proactive and informed, employees can increase their chances of securing a fair severance package and navigating the transition to a new opportunity.

images.alt_text: The current rigid structure pits old against young to create an artificial divide. This often leads to generational tensions and competition for resources.

site_title: Second lease of life for food waste
summary: A tie-up between Metro Farm and social enterprise Life Lab Resources converts food waste into animal feedstock and fish waste into nutrients for growing vegetables, reducing the carbon footprint of aquaponics farming. The partnership aims to close the food loop, producing 30% of Singapore's nutritional needs by 2030. Life Lab's WasteMaster system treats food waste into nutrient-rich feedstock, reducing carbon emissions by 80%. Metro Farm, the first local farm to partner with Life Lab, produces 60 kg of vegetable produce daily and stays cost-competitive by producing fish feed locally.

images.alt_text: In a world now concerned about the fallout from climate change and what it is doing to the environment (the “E”), and how businesses can get on the right side of the laws enacted (the “G”), the “S” or social aspect part of the equation is the forgotten middle child.

site_title: China’s top consumer earnings show stocks recovery is a ways off
summary: China's top consumer companies are reporting disappointing revenue misses, leading to a stock slump that may extend. The MSCI China consumer staples gauge is set for its biggest sales underperformance in at least two years. Major tech firms, including Alibaba and Kuaishou Technology, and retailers like Li Ning have downgraded revenue growth guidance. Analysts expect further disappointment from bellwethers like BYD and Trip.com, with the government showing few signs of boosting consumer confidence. Investors are now awaiting results to gauge the economy's recovery.

images.alt_text: If the selling persists, China may see the first annual outflow from its stock market since 2016.
The company first hatched the plan for an upgrade to a primary listing in Hong Kong two years ago amid heightened tensions with the US.

site_title: Malaysian 5G network owner scraps stake sale to Telekom Malaysia
summary: Digital Nasional Berhad (DNB), Malaysia's sole 5G network owner, has terminated a proposed 233 million ringgit stake sale to Telekom Malaysia due to the latter's failure to obtain shareholder approval by the stipulated deadline on Aug 21. Telekom Malaysia sought an extension until Dec 31, but DNB decided not to extend the deadline. The deal, valued at S$69.3 million, remains scrapped, and the wholesale service subscription between the two companies remains in place.

site_title: Giving feedback can be daunting for new leaders – here’s how to provide it thoughtfully
summary: New leaders struggle to give and receive performance feedback, fearing it may harm workplace relationships. However, thoughtful feedback is crucial for leaders to make informed decisions and adapt to a complex, unpredictable business environment. To provide constructive feedback, leaders should develop their skills, check their motives, choose the right time and setting, separate performance from self-concept, and treat feedback as a gift. By doing so, leaders can build trust, improve decision-making, and foster a culture of continuous learning and engagement, ultimately leading to better performance and team dynamics.

images.alt_text: If leaders and managers create incentives for cooperation and provide opportunities to build trust and positive feelings, individuals will cooperate, even if they dislike each other at first.

site_title: The Black identity in Kamala Harris’ Jamaican roots
summary: Kamala Harris' Jamaican roots reveal a complex history of the Black identity. Born to a Jamaican father and an Indian mother, Harris' family is descended from slaveholders, with her great-great-grandfather Hamilton Brown being a notorious Irish slave owner in Jamaica. Harris' ancestors, including her great-grandmother Christiana Brown, were likely victims of the brutal slave trade, with many dying from starvation and other conditions. Harris has chosen not to emphasize her family's ancestry in her public life, instead embracing her Black identity and rejecting those who question it.

images.alt_text: Democratic presidential nominee and US Vice-President Kamala Harris waves after speaking at the Democratic National Convention (DNC) in Chicago, Illinois, Aug 22, 2024.

site_title: China and UK must be able to talk frankly and cooperate, Starmer tells Xi
summary: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer told Chinese President Xi Jinping that the two countries must be able to talk frankly and cooperate on global issues, including trade, economy, and climate change. Xi expressed hope that Britain would "look at China objectively and rationally." The leaders agreed to work together on global security and climate change as permanent members of the UN Security Council. The phone call aims to strengthen economic ties and address areas of disagreement between the two nations.

images.alt_text: China’s EV makers are grappling with domestic overcapacity for both battery cell and auto production, and Europe is a lucrative export outlet for its manufacturers

site_title: How the Venice Film Festival became an ‘Oscar launchpad’
summary: The Venice Film Festival has transformed into an "Oscar launchpad" since Alberto Barbera's leadership in 2012, with four of the past 10 best picture winners premiering at the festival. Barbera's efforts included renovating facilities, courting Hollywood studios, and showcasing lesser-known titles. The festival has become a platform for Oscar contenders, including blockbusters and indie hits. Its resilience has been evident despite recent challenges, with the festival presenting a robust lineup in 2020 and 2022. Barbera aims to discover new talent and explore contemporary cinema, with over half of this year's competition films featuring new directors.

images.alt_text: French actor Alain Delon at the Cannes Film Festival in May 2019, where he was awarded an honorary Palme d'Or.

site_title: Thai central bank can work with finance ministry, governor says
summary: Thailand's central bank governor, Sethaput Suthiwartnarueput, stated the Bank of Thailand is ready to adjust policy rates if the economic outlook changes. Despite differing views with the new finance ministry under Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra, the central bank is willing to work with anyone. The central bank left its interest rate unchanged for a fifth straight meeting, awaiting changes in the government's policies. If the outlook changes, the central bank is prepared to adjust policy rates to support the economy. The current interest rate remains neutral.

images.alt_text: Thailand's new Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra, known by her nickname "Ung Ing" and daughter of former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra, takes part in a press conference in Bangkok on August 16, 2024. Thai lawmakers on August 16 appointed the 37-year-old daughter of billionaire Thaksin Shinawatra as prime minister, elevating a third member of the influential but divisive clan to the nation's top job. (Photo by Lillian SUWANRUMPHA / AFP)
"As head of the government I will work with parliament with an open heart, open to all ideas to help develop the country," Paetongtarn Shinawatra says.

site_title: In the wake of tragedy, CrossFit faces an identity crisis
summary: CrossFit faces an identity crisis following the death of a competitor, Lazar Dukic, during the CrossFit Games in Texas. The 28-year-old athlete died during an 800-metre open-water swim, marking the first fatality in the event's 17-year history. The incident has raised concerns about the safety of CrossFit as both a workout regimen and an athletic competition. The company has faced criticism for pushing participants too far, with some athletes saying the competition often exceeds what's necessary to test fitness. The incident has sparked calls for accountability among CrossFit leaders, with some athletes questioning the organization's approach to safety.

images.alt_text: Physical activity improves cognitive and mental health in all sorts of ways.
Max burn in minimum time? HIIT it
High Intensity Interval Training commutes to the cubicle

site_title: Chinese smartphone maker Honor gets investment from China Mobile
summary: Chinese smartphone maker Honor received an undisclosed investment from China Mobile's parent company. The investment aims to leverage synergistic advantages in innovation across personal and home device markets. Honor, a former Huawei unit, is gearing up for an initial public offering (IPO). The collaboration is expected to capitalize on Honor's product portfolio and China Mobile's channel resources and user base, providing consumers with a better and more innovative experience.

images.alt_text: Honor is among Shenzhen’s top-six enterprises with industrial output worth over 200 billion yuan, the local government documents showed without specifying a time frame.

site_title: Nestle chairman says no major restructuring planned after shake-up
summary: Nestle's chairman Paul Bulcke stated that there are no major restructuring plans for the company following the replacement of CEO Mark Schneider with Laurent Freixe. Bulcke emphasized the company's focus on strengthening its current portfolio and driving organic growth, with potential adjustments to the portfolio possible but not a priority.

site_title: Why mpox vaccines aren’t flowing to Africans in desperate need
summary: The World Health Organization (WHO) has been slow to approve mpox vaccines for use in low-income countries, including Congo, despite a global health emergency. The WHO has not officially approved the vaccines, which are available from manufacturers such as Bavarian Nordic, despite having the necessary data. The organization's slow response is attributed to its risk-averse approach and lack of flexibility to use alternative approaches. Meanwhile, over 15,000 cases of mpox have been reported in Congo, with at least 550 deaths, and the virus has spread to 13 countries. The WHO has signaled that it will start purchasing vaccines from Bavarian Nordic, but the process is expected to take time.

images.alt_text: Two vaccines, made by Denmark’s Bavarian Nordic and Japan’s KM Biologics, are already approved by regulators around the world, including the United States and Japan.
A health worker discusses treatments with patients at the Munigi mpox treatment center in Nyiragongo territory, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of Congo.

site_title: Industrial Reits maintain resilience despite sector’s slowdown
summary: Industrial Reits in Singapore maintained their resilience despite the sector's slowdown, with most posting positive rental reversions. Mapletree Industrial Trust (MIT) reported a 1.2% year-over-year growth in distributions per unit, while Sabana Industrial Reit achieved the highest rental reversion at 16.8%. The six industrial S-Reits have an average aggregate leverage ratio of 37%, below the sector's average of 39.1%, providing flexibility for potential debt headroom.

images.alt_text: Sabana Industrial Reit says that its portfolio valuation has improved 3.3 per cent year on year to S$914.5 million.

site_title: Robert F Kennedy Jr ends US presidential campaign, endorses Trump
summary: US presidential candidate Robert F Kennedy Jr. ended his campaign and endorsed former President Donald Trump, citing shared issues on border security, free speech, and ending wars. Kennedy, 70, will remove his name from ballots in 10 battleground states, but remain a candidate in other states. The endorsement is seen as unclear whether it will impact the election, with Trump trailing Democratic Vice President Kamala Harris. Kennedy's sister, Kerry Kennedy, criticized the endorsement as a betrayal of family values.

images.alt_text: Democratic presidential nominee and US Vice-President Kamala Harris waves after speaking at the Democratic National Convention (DNC) in Chicago, Illinois, Aug 22, 2024.
Republican presidential nominee and former US President Donald Trump speaks during a visit at the frontier with Mexico in Hereford, Cochise County, Arizona, Aug 22, 2024.

Vice-presidential candidate Tim Walz brought his plain-speaking style and small-town values to the national stage, joined by a litany of political luminaries and star entertainers on the third night of the Democratic National Convention in Chicago.

site_title: Former Trump advisor Steve Bannon must face New York criminal fraud trial, judge rules
summary: Former Trump advisor Steve Bannon, 70, must face a New York trial on criminal fraud charges related to a $15 million fundraising drive for the US-Mexico border wall. A judge ruled against Bannon's motion to dismiss the charges, paving the way for a trial starting on December 9. Bannon is serving a four-month sentence for defying a congressional subpoena. The charges include money laundering and conspiracy, and could potentially impact his release from federal prison just six weeks later.

images.alt_text: Republican presidential nominee and former US President Donald Trump speaks during a visit at the frontier with Mexico in Hereford, Cochise County, Arizona, Aug 22, 2024.

site_title: A century of memories: SICC’s Bukit golf course marks milestone in style
summary: Singapore Island Country Club's (SICC) Bukit golf course is celebrating its 100th anniversary on August 31, 2024. The 18-hole course, designed by James Braid, has hosted numerous international events, including the 1969 World Cup and 28 Singapore Opens. Notable golfers such as Nick Faldo, Lee Trevino, and Vijay Singh have played on the course. The Bukit course has also witnessed memorable triumphs, including Phua Thin Kiay's individual win in the 1967 Putra Cup and Ben Arda's back-to-back wins in the 1973 and 1989 Singapore Opens. A Heritage Gallery has been built to commemorate the course's history.

images.alt_text: A group of 70 golfers, including labour chief Ng Chee Meng, played a final round at the Marina Bay Golf Course on Jun 30, 2024.
President Tharman Shanmugaratnam (centre) with the top sponsors of this year's SICC May Day Charity at a gala dinner on May 1, 2024.

site_title: Kraken must face SEC suit over crypto exchange registration
summary: A US judge has ruled that cryptocurrency platform Kraken must face a Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) lawsuit over operating an unregistered securities exchange. The SEC alleges that Kraken facilitates investment contracts, making them subject to securities laws. However, the judge found that the SEC's labelling of Kraken tokens as "crypto asset securities" is unclear and does not imply individual tokens are securities. Kraken's chief legal officer hailed the ruling as a win for clarity and crypto users, while the SEC maintains its framework for identifying securities applies.

images.alt_text: Richard Teng career includes stints as a senior regulator at the Monetary Authority of Singapore as well as at the city-state’s SGX stock exchange.
Licensing crypto exchanges is a cornerstone in Hong Kong’s Web3 agenda that was first proposed in 2022.
Tether’s eponymous US dollar-pegged stablecoin (USDT) is designed to maintain a constant value of US$1 and is widely used in crypto-to-crypto trading.

site_title: Chinese cars make inroads in Latin America
summary: Chinese car sales have made significant inroads in Latin America, with 51% of all electric vehicle sales and 20% of total car sales in the region. In 2019, China sold $2.2 billion worth of cars in the region, increasing to $8.5 billion last year. Chinese carmakers have offered competitive prices without compromising on quality, and the region's emerging electric vehicle market has seen a significant share of Chinese-made vehicles. This growth is attributed to near-zero duties in countries like Chile, and China's ability to offer cleaner engine technologies, making it an ideal partner for Latin American countries seeking to adopt electro-mobility.

images.alt_text: FILE PHOTO: EV cars are pictured inside BYD's first electric vehicle (EV) factory in Southeast Asia, a fast-growing regional EV market where it has become the dominant player, in Rayong, Thailand, July 4, 2024. REUTERS/Chalinee Thirasupa/File Photo

site_title: Ueda keeps rate hikes in play, talks down BOJ’s part in meltdown
summary: Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda reaffirmed the central bank's commitment to raising interest rates, despite recent market turmoil, and signaled that the next rate hike is not imminent. Ueda attributed the July rate hike to concerns over the US economy, rather than a mistake, and emphasized the need to carefully watch the impact of unstable financial markets on inflation. Economists expect the BOJ to increase borrowing costs again by December, with the yen gaining 0.7% against the dollar following Ueda's comments.

images.alt_text: A screen displays the Nikkei 225 Stock Average figure on the trading floor at the Nomura Securities Co. headquarters in Tokyo, Japan, on Jan. 11, 2024. The Nikkei 225 rose 1.8% to the highest level in about 34 years on Thursday. Photographer: Nao Sano/Bloomberg
Market strategists have warned that the yen carry trade unwinding may have further room to run. There may still be significant risks present for global investors caught on the wrong side.

site_title: Is PropertyGuru’s delisting good for South-east Asia’s tech scene?
summary: PropertyGuru, a South-east Asian property listings portal, is set to be acquired by Swedish private equity firm EQT for US$1.1 billion, with the deal expected to close in Q4 2024 or Q1 2025. Upon completion, the company will be delisted from the New York Stock Exchange and return to being a private firm. The implied price-to-sales multiple is considered reasonable, comparable to other publicly listed property portals. The acquisition is seen as a significant development for South-east Asia's tech scene, marking a shift in the company's ownership structure.

images.alt_text: The transaction is expected to be completed in the last quarter of 2024 or first quarter of 2025.

site_title: Meta says Iranian group tried to target Trump, Biden officials' WhatsApp accounts
summary: Meta identified possible hacking attempts on WhatsApp accounts of US officials from Biden and Trump administrations, blaming Iranian hacker group APT42. The group, linked to Iran's military, was previously linked to breaching Trump campaign accounts. Meta blocked suspicious accounts after users reported activity, citing "social engineering" tactics involving technical support for other companies. No evidence suggested targeted WhatsApp accounts were compromised, and Meta described the attempt as a "small cluster" of activity.

images.alt_text: AI startups such as OpenAI are increasingly hiring business leaders with experience at the larger tech companies as they scale and compete with their peers.
Meta told employees at its Reality Labs division to stop work on the premium mixed-reality headset this week after a product review meeting.

site_title: Apple targets Sep 10 debut for new iPhones, AirPods and watches: Bloomberg
summary: Apple plans to unveil its new iPhones, AirPods, and watches on September 10, with sales starting on September 20. The company is betting on artificial intelligence to attract buyers, following its recent AI strategy unveiling. Despite disappointing China sales, Apple forecasts gains and sees a strong upgrade cycle for the iPhone 16 series, which includes AI features. Analysts expect the new launches to materialize in the short term, but note that Apple remains reliant on iPhone sales.

images.alt_text: The change comes as Apple loosens its grip on devices in the EU due to the bloc’s landmark new digital rules.
FILE PHOTO: A smartphone with a displayed NVIDIA logo is placed on a computer motherboard in this illustration taken March 6, 2023. REUTERS/Dado Ruvic/Illustration/File Photo/File Photo/File Photo

site_title: Trump looks to crash Harris’ party and take back the spotlight
summary: US President Donald Trump is shifting his campaign strategy after entering a month into the presidential election, aiming to regain the spotlight. Following Kamala Harris' entrance into the race, Trump's campaign is now focused on energizing his own campaign, with a busy schedule of events in swing states. Despite initial struggles to define Harris, Trump's attacks on her are starting to gain traction, and his team believes he has a two-to-one advantage over her in key issues like the economy. Harris' candidacy has changed the electoral map, putting back into play swing states that Trump's campaign initially thought they would easily win.

images.alt_text: (FILES) (COMBO) This combination of pictures created on July 22, 2024 shows US Vice President Kamala Harris arriving for an event honoring National Collegiate Athletic Association (NCAA) championship teams from the 2023-2024 season, on the South Lawn of the White House in Washington, DC on July 22, 2024 and former US President and 2024 Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump standing on stage after accepting his party's nomination on the last day of the 2024 Republican National Convention at the Fiserv Forum in Milwaukee, Wisconsin, on July 18, 2024. Republican White House candidate Donald Trump rejected scheduling a debate with his presumptive Democratic challenger Kamala Harris because she has not been officially named her party's nominee, his campaign said on July 25, 2024. site_title: Alternatives matter in the new age of investments
summary: Investors are turning to alternative investments, such as private credit, to navigate the volatile economy. With the rise of private credit, funds like Blackstone Private Credit Fund and Hamilton Lane's Senior Credit Opportunities Fund have offered attractive investment options, outperforming public markets. The sector's growth is expected to continue, with projected assets under management reaching $115.9 billion by 2027. However, investors must remain vigilant and consider the associated risks, including market volatility and competition. Diversification is key to managing risk, and private credit stands out as a robust alternative offering superior risk-adjusted returns and resilience in uncertain economic climates.

images.alt_text: A key risk to investors is a potential surge of redemptions in a fund, the kind of event that produces losses in a panicked, sell-first market. Interval funds must meet such requests, up to a certain amount in a specific period.
Private credit has its origins in financing more highly levered companies, and Blackstone lends to more than 2,000 non-investment-grade borrowers.

site_title: Gold gains over 1% as Powell comments hint at September rate cut
summary: Gold prices rose over 1% on Friday after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell hinted at a potential interest rate cut in September, citing inflation near the Fed's 2% target. The dollar index fell and US 10-year yields declined, making gold more attractive for other currency holders. Analysts expect a 59.5% chance of a 25 basis point rate cut in September, with gold potentially due for a sell-off and profit-taking, but still expected to rise in the long term due to the Fed's efforts to control inflation and employment.

images.alt_text: “The upside risks to inflation have diminished. And the downside risks to employment have increased,” Powell said in a highly anticipated speech to the Kansas City Fed’s annual economic conference in Jackson Hole, Wyoming.

site_title: Ishiba announces bid to succeed Kishida as Japan's leader
summary: Japanese politician Shigeru Ishiba announced his bid to succeed Prime Minister Fumio Kishida in the ruling Liberal Democratic Party leadership election on September 27. Ishiba, a former defence minister, has endorsed the Bank of Japan's interest rate policy. Kishida will step down in September, ending his three-year term as leader of Japan's fourth-largest economy. Ishiba's candidacy marks a significant development in the country's leadership change, which will take place after Kishida's departure.

images.alt_text: FILE PHOTO: Shigeru Ishiba, a member of Japan's ruling Liberal Democratic Party (LDP), speaks during an interview with Reuters in Tokyo, Japan, August 6, 2024. REUTERS/Makiko Yamazaki/File Photo

site_title: Fed’s Powell says ‘time has come’ to cut interest rates
summary: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell stated that "the time has come" for interest rate cuts, citing diminishing upside risks to inflation and increasing downside risks to employment. His confidence in inflation returning to the 2% target has grown, following its rise to 7% during the pandemic. Powell emphasized that the timing and pace of rate cuts will depend on incoming data and the balance of risks.

images.alt_text: US Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell will likely signal - but not explicitly say - that the Fed is looking to start to cut interest rates sooner rather than later, and it’s most likely going to be in September,

site_title: China regulates bond market based on market principles, state media says
summary: China's financial regulators claim to be overseeing the bond market based on market principles and compliance, rejecting allegations of market intervention. Following a crackdown on a record rally, authorities halted trading volume and warned of risks of reckless buying. An investigation into four rural commercial banks over treasuries market manipulation is ongoing. State media stated that regulators will not directly intervene as long as institutions trade according to market principles and rule of law.

images.alt_text: The People's Bank of China (PBOC) building in Beijing, China, on Monday, Aug. 12, 2024. China’s central bank said it’s studying a plan to narrow the range within which short-term interest rates can fluctuate, extending an overhaul of its policy toolkit that aims to guide the market more effectively. Source: Bloomberg

site_title: New Chinese F&B wave hits Singapore and rest of South-east Asia
summary: A new wave of Chinese food and beverage (F&B) chains is expanding into South-east Asia and beyond, driven by saturation at home and a desire to test consumer demand and competence in Western markets. Chinese F&B companies have registered nearly 3.2 million new enterprises in 2023, with many opting for franchising to expand overseas. Brands such as Haidilao, Tai Er, and Zhangliang Malatang have successfully expanded into countries like Singapore, Malaysia, and the US, with many more planning to follow. However, building robust supply chains and overcoming localisation issues remain significant challenges.

images.alt_text: One-Michelin-starred restaurant Sommer will close on Oct 26.

Food Empire chief executive Sudeep Nair said: “As an ASEAN-focused fund with a dynamic network of investors and regional expertise, (Ikhlas Capital) are the best partners to support us as we shift our focus to South-east Asia and South Asia.”

site_title: Tokyo’s tax agency will auction off US$390,000 Ferrari it seized
summary: Tokyo's tax agency will auction off a seized Ferrari NV 488 Pista Spider valued at approximately $510,615. The car was seized from an owner who failed to pay their tax bill. The agency will hold an online auction for the car over two days next month, offering other luxury items including high-end real estate and rare whisky, as well as a golf course.

images.alt_text: A 1955 Ferrari 410 Sport Spider sold for US$12.9 million including fees, the third-highest sale of the weekend.
Sotheby’s on Thursday (Jul 25) unveiled showrooms at an upscale mall in Hong Kong’s finance district, a two-storey space previously occupied by fashion label Giorgio Armani.

site_title: OpenAI taps former Meta executive to head strategic initiatives
summary: OpenAI has hired former Meta executive Irina Kofman to head strategic initiatives, reporting directly to CTO Mira Murati. Kofman, a former senior director of product management for generative AI, will focus on safety and preparedness. This move follows recent hires, including former Instagram and Twitter executive Kevin Weil as chief product officer and former Nextdoor CEO Sarah Friar as chief financial officer. The addition of business leaders with experience at larger tech companies, such as Meta, reflects OpenAI's efforts to scale and compete with peers like Google and Meta.

site_title: ‘Super Bowl’ Nvidia earnings stand to test searing AI trade
summary: Nvidia's upcoming earnings report is set to test market sentiment, with traders pricing in a potential 10.3% swing in the company's shares. The tech giant's earnings have powered the market's rally this year, with its stock jumping 30% since recent lows and 150% year-to-date. The report, due August 28, will provide insight into Nvidia's guidance on corporate investments in AI and its expected demand, which could impact market sentiment heading into a historically volatile September.

images.alt_text: nvidia Photographer: I-Hwa Cheng/Bloomberg

site_title: Europe: Shares end higher as Fed chair Powell backs September rate cuts
summary: European shares rose 0.5% to a three-week high, driven by Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's statement that "the time has come" to reduce interest rates, potentially leading to a rate cut in September. This sentiment was echoed by the European Central Bank, with policymakers lining up for another interest rate cut. The Stoxx 600 index reached its highest level in over three weeks, with gains in real estate and utilities, and losses in the tech sub-index.

site_title: Denza D9 review: The luxury world’s silent killer
summary: BYD's luxury brand Denza is launching a pure electric version of the D9, a plush multi-purpose vehicle, in Singapore on October 10. The D9 boasts a luxurious interior with Business Class seats, individual touchscreens, and a massive chrome face. With a price goal of under S$300,000, Denza aims to compete with established luxury brands. BYD, a 14-year-old joint venture between Warren Buffet-backed BYD and Mercedes-Benz, leads Singapore's car sales charts with 2,587 registrations as of July. The brand plans to launch 10 new models in the next year, including the Z9 GT, a megawatt wagon with 965 horsepower.

site_title: US: Wall Street ends sharply higher as Powell cements September rate cut hopes
summary: US stocks surged sharply on Friday, August 23, as Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's comments solidified expectations of a September interest rate cut. Powell stated that the "time has come" to lower the Fed funds target rate and that "upside risks of inflation have diminished." The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 1.1%, the S&P 500 gained 1.2%, and the Nasdaq Composite added 1.5%, with megacaps Nvidia, Apple, and Tesla leading gains. The Fed's decision is expected to be the first rate cut in over four years.

site_title: Oil climbs over 2% after Fed's Powell indicates US rate cuts
summary: US light crude oil rose over 2% a barrel on Friday after US Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell indicated the central bank is preparing to cut interest rates. Powell's comments, made at the Kansas City Fed's annual economic conference, suggested the Fed is ready to adjust policies to address the job market and inflation. The US dollar index softened ahead of Powell's speech, lifting demand for dollar-denominated oil.

images.alt_text: “The upside risks to inflation have diminished. And the downside risks to employment have increased,” Powell said in a highly anticipated speech to the Kansas City Fed’s annual economic conference in Jackson Hole, Wyoming.

site_title: Trend following amid irrational exuberance
summary: The US stock market has experienced periods of "irrational exuberance" despite warnings from economists, with the cyclically adjusted price-earnings (CAPE) ratio exceeding 22 times in the late 1990s. A trend following approach, which involves buying in uptrends and selling in downtrends based on a 10-month simple moving average, has been shown to outperform the buy-and-hold approach, with lower drawdowns and a higher Sharpe ratio. This approach has also mitigated severe drawdowns during the 2000 and 2008 bear markets.

images.alt_text: NEW YORK, NEW YORK - AUGUST 06: Traders work on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange during morning trading on August 06, 2024 in New York City. Stocks opened up slightly up in the three major indexes a day after the Dow Jones and the S & P 500 had their worst day of trading since 2022, amid a global market sell-off centered around fears of a U.S. recession.   Michael M. Santiago/Getty Images/AFP (Photo by Michael M. Santiago / GETTY IMAGES NORTH AMERICA / Getty Images via AFP)
“Trend following” not only helps investors to stay and profit from the rising trend, but also to reduce losses, especially in a severe decline.

Warren Buffett, chairman and chief executive officer of Berkshire Hathaway., during the company's annual meeting in Omaha, Nebraska, in 2022. Berkshire Hathaway delivered about 20.5 per cent annually from 1965 to 2018.

site_title: Microsoft to host cybersecurity summit after CrowdStrike-induced IT outage
summary: Microsoft will host a cybersecurity summit on September 10 to address issues caused by a faulty CrowdStrike update that disrupted nearly 8.5 million Windows devices on July 19, affecting major airlines, banks, and healthcare. The summit marks Microsoft's first major step in addressing the issue, which impacted operations across various industries. The event will include government representatives and will be held at Microsoft's headquarters in Redmond, Washington.

site_title: Mapletree Pan Asia Commercial Trust obtains HK$1 billion loan
summary: Mapletree Pan Asia Commercial Trust (MPACT) has obtained a HK$1 billion (S$169.8 million) term loan facility, guaranteed by DBS Trustee. The Reit's manager declined to disclose the loan proceeds' use. Conditions under the facility include mandatory prepayment events in the event of manager changes or breaches of trust deed terms. If a prepayment event occurs, it may affect MPACT's outstanding borrowings totaling S$5.9 billion, excluding interest. The manager stated none of these conditions have been breached.

site_title: Oxley Holdings expects net loss for H2, FY2024 earnings
summary: Oxley Holdings expects to post a net loss for both the second half and full year ended June 30, 2024, due to impairment losses, finance costs, and lower revenue from property development projects. The company attributed this to the factors in a bourse filing, with unaudited financial results to be released on or before August 29. Shares of Oxley Holdings closed at S$0.077, down 1.3% from the previous day.

site_title: Bank of England’s Bailey says inflation pressure is on the wane
summary: Bank of England governor Andrew Bailey expressed cautious optimism that inflation expectations are better anchored, citing recent economic signals. He noted that inflation pressure in Britain's economy is becoming less stubborn than in recent years, but still too soon to be sure. The BOE cut its main interest rate to 5% on August 1, following a 16-year high of 5.25%. Bailey's comments come ahead of the central bank's delivery at a central banking conference in Jackson Hole, Wyoming.

images.alt_text: FILE PHOTO: People stand next to the Bank of England, in London, Britain, July 7, 2024. REUTERS/Claudia Greco/File Photo
The BOE remains relatively focused on longer-term inflation pressures, including services prices and wages, as well as general labour market slack.
Officials expect inflation to continue to edge higher over the rest of the year before cooling again, though hot services prices risks causing price pressures to linger.

“The upside risks to inflation have diminished. And the downside risks to employment have increased,” Powell said in a highly anticipated speech to the Kansas City Fed’s annual economic conference in Jackson Hole, Wyoming.

site_title: Indian PM urges Zelenskiy to sit down for talks with Russia
summary: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi urged Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky to engage in talks with Russia to end the war, offering to act as a "friend" to facilitate peace. During a meeting in Kyiv, Modi emphasized the importance of dialogue and diplomacy, stating that both sides should work together to find a resolution. The visit comes at a volatile time in the war, with Moscow making gains in eastern Ukraine. Both leaders hailed the visit as "historic," with Zelensky calling it "very friendly and important for all Ukrainians."

images.alt_text: epa11469927 Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi speaks during a joint press conference with Austria's chancellor in Vienna, Austria, 10 July 2024. It is the first visit by an Indian head of government to Austria in more than 40 years.  EPA-EFE/MAX SLOVENCIK

site_title: US dollar falls after Powell greenlights September easing
summary: US dollar falls to a 17-day low against the yen after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell greenlights September interest rate cuts, citing diminished upside inflation risks and increased downside risks to employment. The dollar also weakens against the euro and sterling, which rise to their highest levels in over two years. Traders bet on a quarter-percentage-point rate cut at the Fed's September meeting, with a one-in-three chance of a 50 basis point cut. The move is seen as a pivot away from the Fed's restrictive interest rate policy since March 2022.

images.alt_text: A Japanese 10,000 yen banknote and US 100 dollar banknotes arranged for a photograph in Tokyo, Japan, on Friday, July 12, 2024.
